quote.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck
quote.content: Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.

quote.author: Anon
quote.content: On the first day, man created god.

quote.author: William Pulteney
quote.content: Never do today what you can put of till' tomorow.

quote.author: Bertrand Russell
quote.content: The time you enjoy wasting, is not wasted time.

quote.author: Stephen Hawking
quote.content: What was God doing before he made the world? Was he preparing hell for people who asked such questions?

quote.author: hXcDiedWithHitler
quote.content: I don't know what tastes better. The sweet tears of Democrats when I tell them I favor the free-market, gun rights, and the abolishment of welfare and government regulation or the sweet tears of Republicans when I tell them I favor gay-rights, free-speech, secularism, and the abolishment of the War on Drugs and Terror.

quote.author: J. K. Rowling
quote.content: If you want to know what a man’s like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.

quote.author: Ron Paul
quote.content: Has nobody noticed that the authorities can't even keep drugs out of the prisons? How can making our entire society a prison solve the problem?

quote.author: Ron Paul
quote.content: Don’t steal – the government hates competition!

quote.author: Benjamin Franklin
quote.content: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.

quote.author: C.S. Lewis
quote.content: Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience.

quote.author: CrimethInc., Expect Resistance: A Field Manual
quote.content: No one is more qualified than you are to decide how you live; no one should be able to vote on what you do with your time and your potential unless you invite them to.

quote.author: Carl Sagan
quote.content: The nuclear arms race is like two sworn enemies standing waist deep in gasoline, one with three matches, the other with five.

quote.author: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones
quote.content: Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him.

quote.author: Joseph Stalin
quote.content: Death solves all problems - no man, no problem.

quote.author: Albert Einstein
quote.content: If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself.

quote.author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote.content: I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity.

quote.author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote.content: Sleep, those little slices of death - how I loathe them.

quote.author: J. K. Rowling
quote.content: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one.

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: There is only one god and his name is Death. And there is only one thing we say to Death: 'Not today'.

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: Why is it that when one man builds a wall, the next man immediately needs to know what's on the other side?

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: Her cunt became the world.

quote.author: Edsger Dijkstra
quote.content: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.

quote.author: Nick Black
quote.content: ...if you aren't, at any given time, scandalized by code you wrote five or even three years ago, you're not learning anywhere near enough.

quote.author: Heraclitus
quote.content: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

quote.author: Francis Underwood
quote.content: A heartbeat away from the presidency, and not a single vote cast in my name. Democracy is so overrated.

quote.author: Oscar Wilde
quote.content: Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power.

quote.author: Mark Twain
quote.content: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience.

quote.author: Louis Pasteur
quote.content: Fortune favors the prepared mind.

quote.author: Epicurus
quote.content: Death is nothing to us. When we exist, death is not; and when death exists, we are not.

quote.author: Epicurus followers gravestones
quote.content: Non fui, fui, non sum, non curo (I was not; I was; I am not; I do not care).

quote.author: Fernando Pessoa
quote.content: To narrate is to create, for living is just being lived.

quote.author: Jacob Hornberger
quote.content: If you are not free to choose wrongly and irresponsibly, you are not free at all.

quote.author: Frédéric Bastiat
quote.content: The state is that great fiction by which everyone tries to live at the expense of everyone else.

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: No one will be alive by the last book. In fact, they all die in the fifth. The sixth book will be just a thousand-page description of snow blowing across the graves...

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: When you tear out a man's tongue, you're not proving him a liar, you're only telling the world what you fear he might say.

quote.author: Jamie Zawinski
quote.content: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think "I know, I'll use regular expressions." Now they have two problems.

quote.author: Hilaire Belloc
quote.content: Whatever happens, we have got the Maxim gun, and they have not.

quote.author: Fisher Ames
quote.content: We are to give money of which we have too little for land of which we already have too much.

quote.author: Aristotle
quote.content: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.

quote.author: Søren Kjær
quote.content: Hvis det er Fakta, saa benægter jeg Fakta.

quote.author: Henry David Thoreau
quote.content: Thank God men cannot fly, and lay waste the sky as well as the earth.

quote.author: Napoleon I of France
quote.content: You would make a ship sail against the winds and currents by lighting a bonfire under her deck? Excuse me, I have no time to listen to such nonsense.

quote.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
quote.content: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

quote.author: Albert Einstein
quote.content: Don't worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater.

quote.author: PEP 20 (The Zen of Python)
quote.content: * Beautiful is better than ugly, * Explicit is better than implicit, * Simple is better than complex, * Complex is better than complicated, * Readability counts.

quote.author: Leopold Kronecker
quote.content: God made the natural numbers; all else is the work of man.

quote.author: Ernest Hemingway
quote.content: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.

quote.author: August Vinkel Sørensen
quote.content: So little is know, so the potential of the QC insn't very earlier derminable.

quote.author: Edward Robert Harrison
quote.content: Hydrogen is a light, odorless gas, which, given enough time, turns into people.

quote.author: Edward Robert Harrison
quote.content: Given enough time, hydrogen starts to wonder where it came from, and where it is going.

quote.author: Bernard Chazelle
quote.content: The plethora of programming languages reveals how so many ways there are of signifying the same thing. (Just as the plethora of political speeches reveals how so many ways there are of signifying nothing.)

quote.author: Homer Simpsons
quote.content: Oh Marge, cartoons don't have any deep meaning. They're just stupid drawings that give you a cheap laugh!

quote.author: Bernard Chazelle
quote.content: To be P or not to be P, that is NP's question.

quote.author: Bernard Chazelle
quote.content: To produce randomness can be quite arduous. To this day, only two methods have been scientifically validated. One of them is the infamous "Kitty Flop." Strap buttered toast to the back of a cat and drop the animal from a PETA-approved height: if the butter hits the ground, record a 1; else a 0. For more bits, repeat. Randomness results from the tension between Murphy's law and the feline penchant for landing on one's feet. The other method is the classical "Coriolis Flush." This time, go to the equator and flush the toilet: if the water whirls clockwise, your random bit is a 1; else it's a 0.

quote.author: Albert Einstein
quote.content: The most incomprehensible thing about the universe is that it is comprehensible.

quote.author: Voltaire
quote.content: This agglomeration which was called and which still calls itself the Holy Roman Empire was neither holy, nor Roman, nor an empire.

quote.author: Anon (maybe Oscar Wilde)
quote.content: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy.

quote.author: Lao Tzu
quote.content: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.

quote.author: Thomas Jefferson
quote.content: Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.

quote.author: Winston Churchill
quote.content: It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried.

quote.author: Thomas Edison
quote.content: We will make electricity so cheap that only the rich will burn candles.

quote.author: J. Robert Oppenheimer, quoting "The Bhagavad Gita"
quote.content: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst at once into the sky, that would be like the splendor of the Mighty One... I am become Death, the Shatterer of Worlds.

quote.author: Steve Wozniak
quote.content: Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.

quote.author: Meta Economics
quote.content: It cannot be too strongly emphasized that the heart, rationale and driving force of modern banking is keeping people in debt. The challenge to banks is to keep the maximum number of people in the greatest amount of debt and with all the security of the nation state’s guarantee.

quote.author: Meyer Rothschild
quote.content: Give me control over a nation's money and I care not who makes its laws.

quote.author: Brian Kernighan
quote.content: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.

quote.author: Anon
quote.content: Since writing on toilet walls is neither done for critical acclaim, nor financial rewards, it is the purest form of art.

quote.author: Blaise Pascal
quote.content: If I had more time, I would have written a shorter letter.

quote.author: Evelyn Beatrice Hall
quote.content: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.

quote.author: John von Neumann
quote.content: You insist that there is something a machine cannot do. If you will tell me precisely what it is that a machine cannot do, then I can always make a machine which will do just that!

quote.author: Brian Kernighan
quote.content: Everyone knows that debugging is twice as hard as writing a program in the first place. So if you're as clever as you can be when you write it, how will you ever debug it?

quote.author: Rasmus Brygger
quote.content: Det forlyder, at Dansk Folkeparti på mandag fremsætter et lovforslag, der skal erstatte det arabiske talsystem med vikingeruner i forsøget på at beskytte Danmark mod hvad Martin Henriksen kalder et "knæfald for islamistisk matematik".

quote.author: Linus Torvalds
quote.content: An infinite number of monkeys typing into GNU emacs would never make a good program.

quote.author: Linus Torvalds
quote.content: Every time I see some piece of medical research saying that caffeine is good for you, I high-five myself. Because I'm going to live forever.

quote.author: Aristotle
quote.content: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

quote.author: septomber32nd
quote.content: If you're not a warg and you're not a targ, then you're Benjen.

quote.author: George R. R. Martin
quote.content: And suddenly his cock was out, jutting upward from his breeches like a fat pink mast.

quote.author: Old Irish Toast
quote.content: Here's to a long life, and a merry one; a quick death, and an easy one; a pretty girl, and an honest one; a cold beer - and another one

quote.author: Jeremy Clarkson
quote.content: Mexico doesn't have an Olympic team... because anyone who can run, jump or swim is already across the border.

quote.author: Deuteronomy 25:11-12
quote.content: If two men are fighting and the wife of one of them comes to rescue her husband from his assailant, and she reaches out and seizes him by his private parts, you shall cut off her hand. Show her no pity.

quote.author: Tom Haverford
quote.content: Sometimes you gotta work a little, so you can ball a lot.
